info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 06 at 5:49PM EDT until April 06 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT FOR SOUTHERN PRINCE EDWARD...NORTHWESTERN LUNENBURG AND WEST CENTRAL NOTTOWAY COUNTIES... At 548 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Hampden Sydney College to near Abilene, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. These severe storms will be near... Burkeville around 605 PM EDT. Crewe around 610 PM EDT. Green Bay around 615 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Briery Creek Lake, Prince Edward Station, Briery, Virso, Meherrin, Prince Edward Lake, Twin Lakes State Park, Oliveville, Burkes Tavern and Scholfield. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
